ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc49:1.1_0: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc49:1.2_0: the monks from the group of six went to the army on some business, and they stayed there for more than three nights.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc49:1.3_0: People complained and criticized the monks,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc49:1.4_0: “How can the Sakyan ascetics stay with the army?
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc49:1.5_0: It’s our misfortune that we must stay with the army for the sake of our livelihood and because of our wives and children.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc49:1.6_0: The monks heard the complaints of those people
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc49:1.7_0: The monks of few desires complained and criticized Udāyī,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc49:1.8_0: “How can the monks from the group of six stay with the army for more than three nights?” ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc49:1.9_0: “Is it true, monks, that you did this?”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc49:1.12_0: “... Foolish men, how can you stay with the army for more than three nights?
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc49:1.13_0: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it ...” ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc49:1.14_0: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc49:1.15.1_0: ‘If that monk has a reason for going to the army, he may stay with the army for two or three nights.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc49:1.15.1_1: If he stays longer than that, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc49:2.1.1_0: If that monk has a reason for going to the army:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc49:2.1.2_0: if there is a reason, if there is something to be done.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc49:2.1.3_0: He may stay with the army for two or three nights:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc49:2.1.4_0: he may stay for two or for three nights.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc49:2.1.5_0: If he stays longer than that:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc49:2.1.6_0: if he is staying with the army at sunset on the fourth day, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc49:2.2.1_0: If it is more than three nights, and he perceives it as more, and he is staying with the army, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc49:2.2.2_0: If it is more than three nights, but he is unsure of it, and he is staying with the army, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc49:2.2.3_0: If it is more than three nights, but he perceives it as less, and he is staying with the army, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc49:2.2.4_0: If it is less than three nights, but he perceives it as more, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc49:2.2.5_0: If it is less than three nights, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc49:2.2.6_0: If it is less than three nights, and he perceives it as less, there is no offense.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc49:2.3.1_0: there is no offense for him.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc49:2.3.2_0: if he stays for two or three nights;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc49:2.3.3_0: if he stays together for less than two or three nights;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc49:2.3.4_0: if he stays for two nights, then leaves before dawn on the third night, and then stays again;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc49:2.3.5_0: if he stays because he is sick;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc49:2.3.6_0: if he stays because there is something to be done for someone who is sick;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc49:2.3.7_0: if the army is obstructed by an enemy army;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc49:2.3.11_0: if he is the first offender.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc49:2.3.12_0: The ninth rule, the training rule on staying with armies, is finished.
